document.docAuthor: Truong, Xuan Lam, Zhao, Ping & Cai, Wan Zhi
document.docTitle: Rhachicephala dilatibia Truong, Zhao & Cai, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Notes on the subfamily Salyavatinae (Hemiptera: Reduviidae) from Vietnam, with the description of a new genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Notes on the subfamily Salyavatinae (Hemiptera: Reduviidae) from Vietnam, with the description of a new genus

heading.emphasis:
Rhachicephala dilatibia Truong, Zhao & Cai
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Color. Body brown. Head, neck, scutellum, base of first antennal segment, second to fourth antennal segments, rostrum (except inner surface of first segment), anterior pronotal lobe (except glabrous sculptures), spots on connexivum, narrow median longitudinal stripe and apical portion of abdomen ventrally, thoracic sterna and pleura, coxae and trochanters, all spines (except spines on subapical portion of mid and hind femora beneath) dark brown to black; connexivum (except dark spots) yellowish; eyes dark purplish brown; posterior pronotal lobe brown with two pale longitudinal stripes sublaterally; hemelytra pale brown, with pale yellowish brown markings; first antennal segment (except base), femur (except subapical annulation) yellowish brown to brown; tibia (except apex, base and subbasal annulation) light yellowish brown. Most of abdomen beneath light brown.

Material examined. Holotype , ď, Vietnam , Ninh Thuan Province, Ninh Hai District, Da Thao-Da Nhay, 700 m ,
23 .VI. 2004
, Xuan Lam Truong leg ( IEBR ). Paratypes , 1 Ψ, Vietnam , Dong Nai Province, Cat Tien National Park,
24 .X. 2002
, Xuan Lam Truong leg ( IEBR ); 2 ď, 1 Ψ, Vietnam , Dong Nai Province, Cat Tien National Park,
25 .IX. 2004
, Xuan Lam Truong leg ( IEBR ); 2 ď, Vietnam , Tay Ninh, Lo Go National Park,
8 .XI. 2003
, Xuan Lam Truong leg ( CAU ); 1 Ψ, Vietnam , Tay Ninh, Lo Go National Park,
6 .XI. 2003
, Xuan Lam Truong leg ( CAU ). 1 Ψ, Vietnam , Tay Ninh, Lo Go National Park,
7 .XI. 2003
, Xuan Lam Truong leg ( CAU ).

paragraph.emphasis: 4 . Genus Va le n ti a

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Valentia
Stål, 1866 a
: 144
. Type species by subsequent designation (
Stål, 1866 b: 166
):
Petalocheirus apetalus
Vuillefroy, 1864
: 142
. Putshkov & Putshkov 1985 : 98 ; 1995 : 208 ;
Maldonado-Capriles 1990
: 489
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnostic characters. Body of medium size, somewhat slender, dull. Anteocular part much shorter than postocular, first antennal segment distinctly longer than head; first rostral segment subequal to or slightly shorter than second. Collar processes not developed. Lateral pronotal angles and apex of scutellum spinous (
Figs. 40 –41
,
53– 54
); prosternum anteriorly with two tubercles ( Figs. 41 , 54 ). Fore femora straight; fore tibiae anteriorly ampliated and compressed, apex broad ( Figs. 40 , 42 , 53 , 55 ); femora beneath subapically with a short spine; posterior angle of each connexival segment spinous.

paragraph.emphasis: Key to Vietnamese species of the genus Va le n ti a

paragraph.keyLead:
1 . Fore tibia gradually strongly dilated from base to apex for its entire length ( Figs. 40 , 42 ); fore femora nearly as long as fore tibiae; ventral surface of abdomen with black median longitudinal stripe; second antennal segment unicolored; anterior angle of prosternum round with a small tubercule (
Fig. 41
)............
............................................................................................................................. Valentia compressipes
Stål

-. Fore tibia with basal half thin and apical half gradually dilated ( Figs. 53 , 55 ); fore femora slightly longer than fore tibiae; ventral surface of abdomen without black median longitudinal stripe; subapical portion of second antennal segment orange to pale yellowish brown (
Fig. 53
); anterior angle of prosternum anteriorly with obtuse spine (
Fig. 54
)
............................................................................ Valentia hoffmanni
China

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Valentia compressipes
Stål, 1874
: 82
;
Hsiao et al. 1981
: 417
. Putshkov & Putshkov 1995 : 208 ;
Maldonado-Capriles 1990
: 489
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Redescription. Color. Body dull yellowish brown; head, anterior pronotal lobe, propleural episternum, meso- and metapleura, thoracic sterna, scutellum, most of coxae, abdominal tip, lateral pronotal spines, thin median longitudinal stripe of abdomen ventrally, posterior half of connexival segments (including spines) black; posterior pronotal lobe, propleural epimeron dark brown; second to fourth antennal segments blackish brown; first antennal segment, rostrum, trochanter, all femora (except indistinct subapical annulation), mid and hind tibiae (except indistinct annular markings) yellowish brown; two obscure median annulations of mid and hind tibiae, an indistinct subapical annular stripe of femur pale yellowish brown; fore tibia (except basal portion and apical portions), coxal cavity of fore leg yellowish; ventral surface of abdomen (except median longitudinal stripe) yellowish brown to dull yellowish brown; hemelytra dull brown, with pale yellowish brown markings.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 40.
Valentia compressipes
Stål
, ♂, habitus. Scale bar = 2.35 mm.

FIGURES 41–52.
Valentia compressipes
Stål
, ♂. 41, Head, pronotum and scutellum, antennae partly removed; 42, fore leg (part); 43, 44, apical portion of abdomen; 45, 46, pygophore; 47–49, paramere; 50–52, phallus; 41, 44, 45, 51, lateral view; 43, 46, 52, ventral view; 50, dorsal view. Scale bar of 41–44 = 0.625 mm; of 45, 46 = 0.25 mm; of 47–52 = 0.40 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Measurements [ď (n= 4 )/ Ψ (n= 3 )]. Body length 14.39–16.01 / 17.12–18.64 ; maximum width abdomen 3.89–4.46 / 4.99–5.59 . Length head 2.00– 2.10 / 2.21–2.57 ; length anteocular portion 0.42–0.47 / 0.45–0.63 ; length postocular portion 0.95–1.05 / 1.05–1.16 ; length synthlipsis 0.79–0.84 / 0.79–1.05 ; interocellar space 0.18–0.21 / 0.18–0.21 ; length antennal segments I–IV= 3.05–3.41 / 3.07–3.62 , 5.93–6.14 / 5.25–6.72 ,? / 1.39 ,? / 1.16 ; length rostral segments I–III = 0.95–0.97 / 1.00– 1.21 , 0.89–0.95 / 1.00– 1.16 , 0.68–0.71 / 0.71–0.79 ; length anterior pronotal lobe 0.95–1.05 / 1.00– 1.16 ; length posterior pronotal lobe 1.58–1.84 / 2.10–2.36 ; maximal width thorax 3.07–3.26 / 3.68–4.15 ; length scutellum 0.95 –1.00 / 0.95–1.16 ; length hemelytron 10.03–11.34 / 11.81–13.13 .

Material examined: 1 Ψ, Vietnam , Dong Nai Province, Cat Tien National Park,

, Cai Wanzhi leg ( CAU ); 2 Ψ, China , Yunnan, Menglun, 28,

, Cai Wanzhi leg ( CAU ); 1 ď, China , Yunnan, Menghai,
30 .V. 1991
, Cai Wanzhi leg ( CAU ); 1 ď, China , Yunnan, Mengla, 580 m ,
14 .V. 1991
, Cai Wanzhi leg ( CAU ).
Notes: We have only one specimen of this species from Vietnam . The study of the species is partly based on Chinese specimens.
